body.p:
I have signed the BillAct of the Legislature "To prohibit & prevent rebellion" &c" with great reluctance and many doubts as to its Constitutionality, and only after receiving the following opinion from the Atto General -- To-wit (there insert it) although the policy of this bill seems to be evil & barbarous, inflicting such punishment for an honest difference of political opinions, it will be preferable for offenders to be tried under the laws of the state, and by a Jury of the view composed of thiseir neighbors, than toby the laws of the government under a charge of treason. The laws reorganizing the Military Board and authorizing the borrowing of vast sums of money" received my signature with great hesitation, because of the dangerous powers
2
confered upon the Board without responsibility & without requiring security for the faithful disbursement of the money ^and performance of of duty^ ourThe state will become bankrupt and demoralized by such a policy and ^The Legislature fresh from the people and overwhelmingly differs with me^ could I have arrested it by a veto, notwithstanding the opinion of the Atto General, which is as follows to wit (here insert it) ^marked No 21^) -- I would have with held my sanction to the bill.

Reasons --
Stated for signing certain Acts of Genl. Assembly
Entered in Ex= Journal
Octo 2d 1861
Jas W Tate
Asst. Secy
